channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Adrienne Adams, in NYC Mayor Campaign, Pitches Big Guaranteed Income Program
item.description: Adrienne Adams, the New York City Council speaker who is running for mayor, released a plan to provide guaranteed income for thousands of homeless fam...

item.title: EU leaders split over hitting U.S. services sector in retaliation to Trump trade tariffs
item.description: While France and Germany are calling for an "aggressive" response, Ireland, Italy and Spain want a "calm and measured" approach.

item.title: Ukraine Questions Value of Black Sea Truce With Russia
item.description: Ukrainian Navy officers and business owners in the port city pondered what Kyiv could gain from a truce after it pushed back Russian vessels and resum...

item.title: Jamie Dimon concerned Trump tariffs will leave the U.S. out in the cold: ‘America First is fine, as long as it doesn’t end up being America alone’
item.description: Jamie Dimon's annual letter to shareholders warned that Trump's tariffs may push America's former allies to rely more heavily on nations like China an...

item.title: Trump is reportedly planning the military parade he has long wanted for his 79th birthday
item.description: He called for one in his first term, but the price tag was said to be too high at $92 million.

item.title: R.F.K. Jr’s Plan to Send Health Officials to Indian Country Angers Native Leaders
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says he is committed to improving the Indian Health Service. Native American leaders have doubts. “It’s shamefu...

item.title: Doral is home to one of Trump’s golf clubs. Its mayor is pleading with the president to spare Venezuelan families from deportation: ‘These families do not want handouts’
item.description: Trump has ended two federal programs that allowed more 700,000 Venezuelans to live and work legally in the U.S.

item.title: How Contracting Work Became a Race to the Bottom
item.description: The reality of being a contractor includes labor shortages, brutal competition and low, low margins.

item.title: Turnover for S&P 500 CFOs tops 17% this year as the C-suite job ‘really just takes a toll’
item.description: The high CFO turnover rate tracked with the similarly steep CEO turnover figures.

item.title: Why Earthquake Relief Is Slow to Reach Myanmar
item.description: Critics say the country’s often-incompetent military government has delayed and restricted the arrival and distribution of crucial aid.

item.title: What to Know About the Destructive Spring Storm System
item.description: Heavy rains, damaging winds and dangerous floods have ravaged the South and the Midwest for days, killing at least 18 people.

item.title: In a Strongman State, a Trump Order Extinguishes Flickers of Freedom
item.description: Cambodia’s authoritarian dynasty had silenced almost all of the country’s independent media. The remaining few are facing extinction because of an exe...

item.title: Putin Congratulates Alex Ovechkin for Breaking NHL Record
item.description: Alex Ovechkin’s feat put a fresh spotlight on the hockey star’s past support for Russia’s leader and on his stance on the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Ukraine Questions Value of Black Sea Truce With Russia
item.description: Ukrainian Navy officers and business owners in the port city pondered what Kyiv could gain from a truce after it pushed back Russian vessels and resum...

item.title: Live Updates: Wall Street Wavers as Trump Defends His Tariffs
item.description: The S&P 500 briefly entered bear market territory, after more losses in Asia and Europe. President Trump said he would not back off his trade war, rei...
